Inside, a well trained staff sees to the needs of guests.  These folk are amiable to travelers, ready to answer questions about [[The Shadowfell]] and provide basic services.  They hesitate only when questions about how they came to work at the inn, quickly finding excuses to change the subject or disengage.  For the equivalent of 5 silver you can get a room upstairs and a hot meal.

[[Yarol]] himself is a [[Shadar-Kai]], a race of [[Human]] accustomed to living within [[The Shadowfell]].  He has a soft spot for newcomers to the realm, easy to spot from the confusion placed upon their faces.  Whether a lost [[Soul]] or cosmic wanderer, [[Yarol]] temporarily hires them on as staff and sees they are cared for until they can find their way home.  Some decide to stay on permanently.

Key staff members include [[Kravdak]], an [[Orc]] warrior who stumbled into [[The Shadowfell]] decades ago and stayed on as a bouncer, and [[NullaQuimo]] ("little apple" in [[Elvish]]), an [[Elf]] maiden who runs the head of house.

!The Origin
The House Of Black Lanterns was forged (or more appropriately, birthed) by the [[Fey]] [[Hag]] [[Babaroga]] after the fall of [[The Court Of Stars]].  It is powered by the very essence of [[The Shadowfell]] and the [[Beating Heart|The Heart Of VanwaHeru]] of [[VanwaHeru]] that allows the interior of the building to transform into what is required, from cottage home to a bustling inn.  [[The Heart|The Heart Of VanwaHeru]] burns as an enteral flame in the hearth of The House Of Black Lanterns, and forms the consciousness of the building.
The House Of The Eternal is the seat of power for [[The Children Of The Forge]], within the city of [[Anmanu]] on the continent of [[Caldoria]].  It is a grey ruin, decrepit but functional.  It is the stronghold for [[The Children Of The Forge]] but has not been repaired or expanded upon in ages.  The power and prestige of [[The Children Of The Forge]] has waned over the generations.  It has become difficult to find younglings willing to undergo the rituals to meld themselves to [[Magic]] and metal.  Even so, [[The Children Of The Forge]] command a healthy respect from those in [[Caldoria]].
The Infernal Hierarchy is the torturous process that [[Souls|Soul]] undergo within [[Baator]].  They begin their journey as [[Soul Larvae]] in [[Avernus]], and through increasingly malevolent acts, evolve through various set demonic forms. Each stage of transformation strengthens their corruption, drawing them closer to their ultimate destiny.

Their ascent through this cruel process is meticulously designed to fortify [[Baator's|Baator]] legions and weed out the weakest links. Each step in the Infernal Hierarchy refines and toughens them, ensuring only the most malevolent and potent [[Dathairä]] rise to prominence. This unrelenting journey is a testament to the calculated cruelty that defines [[Baator]], forever driving [[Dathairä]] to prove their worth—or be consumed by the very darkness they seek to master.

!The Hierarchy
The hierarchy is rigid and unforgiving, with [[Archdevils|Archdevil]] occupying its apex. One's position within the hierarchy dictates their power, stemming from their mastery over the essence of evil itself.  The Hierarchy has dead-ends and offshoots that are less appealing, where one can lose control of their mind or become bestial in nature; losing all hope of further ascension.
{{quote{
//For every crime: punishment, for ever restitution: balance.//
''-The Iron Law''
}}}
The Iron Law is the ancient legal system of [[The Hegemony]] of [[Ruje]], originally from [[The Vaecnan Dynasty]].  Over the centuries it was been modified into a mockery of the original legal system, wrought with corruption and cruelty, structured in a way that pins the lower class into their station while elevating [[The Aurum]].  The Iron Law contains a number of specific offenses directed at curtailing the practice of different forms of [[Magic]], these include "Consortation with Demonic Powers, "Malicious Use of Unnatural Arts", and "Malfeasance".  Historically the punishment for circumventing these prohibitions was extremely severe, although modern sensibilities have overcome long lost superstitions and it has been a considerable time since such draconic provisions on [[Magic]] have been enforced.

The Iron Law is structured into the same three main offenses as the original laws from [[The Vaecnan Dynasty]]: Spells, Crueltys, and Transgressions.  The law is clear that for any crime commited, an equal punishment is paid.  Punishments are very specific, from lashing, to dismemberment, to death.  However [[The Hegemony]] has added costs for each transactions that could be paid in their place.  Paying a guard, or the state, or the transgressed could eliminate the crime from the ledgers.  Every crime has a price, even if that price is purposefully absurd.

Some laws have a close connection to the religion of [[The Church Of The Final Atonement]], and The Iron Law often quotes their holy book [[The Book Of Atl]].  By quoting the book, the law gives power to [[The Church|The Church Of The Final Atonement]], and allows them to bypass many crimes or refuse to pay when they are accused.

Some of the most dark laws are left over from laws imposed during [[The Oeridian Kingdoms]] and [[The Vaecnan Dynasty]].  One of the most notorious involves the [[Draugr]]: "All [[Draugr]] must register with the state as being a slave to its family" and its sister law "upon death, all [[Duergeran]] are hereby adopted by [[The Undying King|The Whispered One]]".
[>img[images/maps/continents/kellos/the-isles.jpg]]
The Isles are a more isolated portion of [[The Viridian Empire]].  This isolation coupled with the local culture of [[Magic]] are legendary.  The region is ruled by [[House Vaisanan]].  [[The Narrows]] is a small sea separating The Isles from the mainland of [[Kellos]], and the remainder of the land is surrounded by [[The Atlian Ocean]].

!The Zynovan
The people who inhabit The Isles identify themself as [[Zynovan]], a name that derives from the ancient confederation of [[Mage-Lords|Mage-Lord]] known as [[The Zynovum Arcanum]].  The [[Zynovan]] remain undisputed architects of [[Asha's|Asha]] [[Magical Advancement|Magic]].  To a [[Zynovan]], [[Magic]] is not a mysterious force to be feared, but a fundamental utility, the bedrock upon which a perfected society must be built from.  They see the pursuit of [[Magic]] as the highest calling of civilization.

!Notable Locations
* [[Zylok]]
* [[NorthwardTower]] is a military tower/garrison on the north side of the isle, build upon a rocky cliff with a good view of the sea.
* [[SouthwardTower]] has been long since abandoned, similar to Northward Tower.
* [[Stoneboro]] is a quaint farming community.
* [[Jenkel]] is a moderate size fishing/whaling village.
* [[Waymeet]] is a Dwarven/human outpost. The last stop before the underground Dwarven stronghold.
* [[Avorbarath]] is a [[Dwarven|Dwarf]] [[Stronghold]]
|!Link: [[House Jedaleon]]|

The Jedaleon Dynasty refers to the direct bloodline of [[Empress|Emperor]] [[Lysandra Jedaleon]], the first of her name, who reigned from 862 [[AAP]] to 898 [[AAP]].  This dynasty ruled [[The Viridian Empire]] from 862 [[AAP]] to current, a period of [[Magical|Magic]] innovation, technological marvel, and social reform.  The Jedaleons sought to unify reason with power, order with mercy; ruling a dynasty of relative stablity rarely seen in [[Asha's|Asha]] tumultuous [[History]].  

!The Jedaleon Dynasty
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/lysandra-jedaleon-portrait.jpg][Lysandra Jedaleon]] <br>[[Lysandra Jedaleon]] |''__[[Lysandra Jedaleon]]__''<br>862 [[AAP]] - 898 [[AAP]] was the first ruler of The Jedaleon Dynasty.  Originally niece of [[Emperor]] [[Calvather Nerenic]], she rose to power after serving as guardian to his daughter, [[Princess]] [[Elyra Nerenic]], a gifted but unstable [[Wild Magic]] [[Sorcerer]].  Lysandra assumed role as [[Empress]] after the tragic death of [[Elyra|Elyra Nerenic]]; an event that tempered her rule and filled her with mercy and compassion. | 36 years <br/> "The Beloved" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/historic/jacob-jedaleon-i-portrait.jpg][Jacob Jedaleon I]] <br>[[Jacob Jedaleon I]] |''__[[Jacob Jedaleon II]]__''<br>898 [[AAP]] - 904 [[AAP]] - was a fervent disciple of [[The Divine Order]].  His zeal, however, often turned to extremism; his early reforms were accompanied by purges of heretics.  He declared the resurgent [[Paladin]] order of [[The Branded]] heretic and enemy of [[The Viridian Empire]], after a small few attempted to resurrect the ancient and lost practice.  While his short reign ended abruptly, [[Jacob I|Jacob Jedaleon I]] ruled with a moral compass that his descendants would emulate. | 6 years <br/> "The Holy" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/historic/jayce-jedaleon-i-portrait.jpg][Jayce Jedaleon I]] <br>[[Jayce Jedaleon I]] |''__[[Jayce Jedaleon I]]__''<br>904 [[AAP]] - 916 [[AAP]] - was a man of great charisma but poor foresight.  He sought to expand [[The Empire|The Viridian Empire]] though rapid military campaigns known as [[The Falconer's War]].  His disastrous handling of [[The Northern Border|The Northlands]] led to countless death, a weakened military force, and fractured ties to [[The Kellish People|Kell]]. | 12 years <br/> "The Brash" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/historic/avira-jedaleon-portrait.jpg][Avira Jedaleon]] <br>[[Avira Jedaleon]] |''__[[Avira Jedaleon]]__''<br>916 [[AAP]] - 927 [[AAP]] was known for her grace and political insight, a skilled diplomat who guided [[The Empire|The Viridian Empire]] out of the debt and strife left by [[her father|Jayce Jedaleon I]].  In a move of both political astuteness and love, she married [[Thormond Karbold]], a [[Kellish|Kell]] leader, which brought [[The Northlands]] under [[Imperial|The Viridian Empire]] influence.  She also oversaw the cultivation of the fertile [[Green Sea|The Green Sea]], and agricultural plain that became the breadbasket of [[The Empire|The Viridian Empire]]. | 11 years <br/> "The Rose" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/historic/willard-jedaleon-portrait.jpg][Willard Jedaleon]] <br>[[Willard Jedaleon]] |''__[[Willard Jedaleon]]__''<br>927 [[AAP]] - 953 [[AAP]] [[Willard’s|Willard Jedaleon]] reign was defined by stability and fairness. A beloved ruler, he enacted laws to protect the rights of the lower classes and restructured the military after [[Jayce I's|Jayce Jedaleon I]] failures. While his reign saw peace and growth, his reluctance to confront corruption within [[the nobility|Houses Of The Viridian Empire]] created underlying tensions. | 26 years <br/> "The Good" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/historic/kevan-jedaleon-portrait.jpg][Kevan Jedaleon]] <br>[[Kevan Jedaleon]] |''__[[Kevan Jedaleon]]__''<br>953 [[AAP]] - 956 [[AAP]] his reign was plagued by a chilling disaster known as [[The Great Blight]], which brought catastrophic famine and widespread plague. Though these events were beyond his control, [[Kevan’s|Kevan Jedaleon]] poor decisions in handling these crises earned him his unfortunate epithet. His untimely death added to his reputation as cursed by fate.| 3 years <br/> "The Unlucky" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/historic/roderik-jedaleon-ii-portrait.jpg][Roderik Jedaleon II]] <br>[[Roderik Jedaleon II]] |''__[[Roderik Jedaleon II]]__''<br>956 [[AAP]] - 975 [[AAP]] earned the title "The Anvil" for his resilience during turbulent times. He revitalized the military, quelling [[The Third Chains Rebellion]] and securing [[The Empire’s|The Viridian Empire]] borders. His reign was marked by hard choices and relentless focus, though his harsh methods made him unpopular among the lower classes.| 19 years <br/> "The Anvil" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/historic/jayce-jedaleon-ii-portrait.jpg][Jayce Jedaleon II]] <br>[[Jayce Jedaleon II]] |''__[[Jayce Jedaleon II]]__''<br>975 [[AAP]]  - 990 [[AAP]] sought to restore [[The Empire’s|The Viridian Empire]] grandeur with daring reforms and campaigns. He expanded trade routes and led expeditions to distant lands, bringing both wealth and exotic goods. However, his ambitious projects often strained resources, leaving his successors to address the fallout. | 15 years <br/> <br/> "The Bold" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/jacob-jedaleon-portrait.jpg][Jacob Jedaleon III]] <br>[[Jacob Jedaleon III]] |''__[[Jacob Jedaleon III]]__''<br>990 [[AAP]] - 1026 [[AAP]] was [[Emperor]] of [[The Viridian Empire]].  Ruler of the [[Kell]], the [[Amonite]], and the [[Uskardeen]].  His last wife died giving birth to his daughter [[Natalia Jedaleon]].  That caused him to grown distant and morose, and he did not take another lover.  He cared dearly for his people and [[The Divine Order]], no matter how despondent he became.  He was murdered by the [[Dracolich]] [[Gorgothuun]], an agent of [[The Whispered One]] and [[The Remnant]] in 1025 [[AAP]]. | 36 years <br/> <br/> "The Wise" |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/galad-jedaleon-portrait.jpg][Galad Jedaleon]] <br>[[Galad Jedaleon]]  |''__[[Galad Jedaleon]]__''<br>1026 [[AAP]] - Current The current [[Emperor]] of [[The Viridian Empire]]. Ruler of the [[Kell]], the [[Amonite]], and the [[Uskardeen]]. He is a tall and handsome young man, everything a budding [[Emperor]] should be. He strives hard to achieve, due to the incompetence of his [[younger brother|Greco Jedaleon]] (whom [[Galad Jedaleon]] loves dearly). He is working very hard to continue [[his father’s|Jacob Jedaleon III]] dream. He secretly does not wish to be [[Emperor]], but continues because [[his brother|Greco Jedaleon]] is not of the quality to assume the throne. | "The Fair" |
[>img[images/maps/continents/kellos/the-keep.jpg]]
The Keep is the largest region, and houses the capital of [[The Viridian Empire]].  The region is ruled by [[House Jedaleon]].

!Notable Locations
* [[Deepwater]]
* [[Laranor]]
* [[Arroweed]]
* [[Drellin's Ferry]]
* [[Oakwood]] is a village not far from Deepwater that performs most of the agricultural responsibilities of the empire.
* [[Mirror Lake]] is a small city that overlooks a pristine lake.  It is a way point for travels west.
* [[Mrygan]] is another bustling trading post at the edge of Deepwater’s borders.
[>img[images/locations/baator/stygia/the-kiln-of-the-profaned.jpg]]
The Kiln Of The Profaned is the mechanism by which [[Dathairä]] reform and regrow from grievous injury and even death.  It is a painful process, in which the creature slowly forms into an embryo of blood and flesh, suspended by chains of sinew within a flesh covered room.  The growth process can takes months, and the embryo must be fed a number of [[Souls|Soul]] equivalent to the rank of the [[Dathairä]].

[[Dathairä]] harvest and store a collection of [[Souls|Soul]] for safe keeping, to be used in the event their rebirth.  The number of [[Souls|Soul]] need can be excruciatingly large, and lesser [[Dathairä]] struggle to pay; forcing them into a devolved status, lower in the rank of [[Baator]].  This is not only a social embarrassment, but the [[Dathairä]] loses all power and privileges they might have once held.

While The Kiln Of The Profaned is formally located within the layer of [[Baator]] known as [[Stygia]], and oversaw by [[Belphagor]], those [[Dathairä]] rich and wealthy enough have their own Kiln within their private fortress.  This is not only a matter of convenience, but it can be difficult to trust a rival like [[Belphagor]] for such a transaction as one's rebirth.
The Kin Folk are a classification of [[Fey]] in [[The Feywild]], representing sentient, humanoid woodland beast creatures who embody the essence of the natural world. They tend to live honest, hardworking lives tending to the land.  The Kin Folk value community, loyalty, and self-sufficiency, and their strength lies in their deep connection to the land and the cycles of life. 

They are primarily found in rural regions of [[The Feywild]], where they cultivate crops, raise animals, and live in close harmony with nature.  Even more so than the other [[Fey]], the Kin Folk are deeply connected to the animals and creatures of the wild, resembling humanoid versions of these beings while maintaining their instinctual ties to nature. Though they are not as flamboyant or powerful as other [[Fey]], they are steadfast and resilient, embodying the unyielding spirit of those who labor with their hands and hearts.

!Notable Kinfolk Races
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/harengon-portrait.jpg][Harengon]] |__[[Harengon]]__ are agile, swift, and industrious, living in tight-knit communities.  They are known for their resourcefulness and resilience, often thriving in the face of hardship.  They are blessed with [[Fey]] luck, and often find themselves a few fortunate feet away from dangers.  [[Harengon]] tend to fields and gardens, excelling in agriculture and taking pride in their ability to cultivate life from the land.  Their quick reflexes and sharp minds make them prone to laziness. |
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/tortle-portrait.jpg][Tortle]] |__[[Tortle]]__ are slow moving but deeply wise, embodying patience and the steady passage of time.  They are master builders and architects, constructing intricate homes and villages.  They are storytellers, and adept in the use of [[Magic]].  There are few [[Tortle]] left in [[The Feywild]], their time upon the land fading. |
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/grung-portrait.jpg][Grung]] |__[[Grung]]__ are amphibious, skilled at farming both on land and in water.  They prefer wet environments, often building their homes near rivers, lakes or swamps.  [[Grung]] communities are lively and close-knit, with a focus on cooperation and harmony.  As a [[Race|Races]], they are forever jubilant and optimistic, always seeing the good in any situation. |
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/nibbling-portrait.jpg][Nibbling]] |__[[Nibbling]]__ are treasure hunters at heart, able to find value in things other might overlook.  They are always on the lookout for [[Wishstones|Wishstone]], which form underground in [[The Feywild]].  These [[stones|Wishstone]], care prized for their beauty and adorn nearly every aspect of [[Nibbling]] life.  They keep the [[stones|Wishstone]] formed from good intentions, discarding those formed from malevolent wishes.  Despite their small size, [[Nibblings|Nibbling]] have a hearty appetite, consuming a considerable amount of food. |
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/urson-portrait.jpg][Urson]] |__[[Urson]]__ are bear-like Kin Folk, known for their strength and stoic demeanor.  They are hardworking, and fiercely protective of their homes in [[The Feywild]].  Their family values loyalty above all else, and their great physical strength is matched by a gentle heart.  They work tirelessly during the harvest season, ensuring that there is plenty of food stored for winter. |
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/rikani-portrait.jpg][Rikani]] |__[[Rikani]]__ are mischievous and clever, known for their resourcefulness and adaptability.  [[Rikani]] love to tinker and create, constantly experimenting with tools and building devices to improve the efficiency of their work.  Their curious nature and quick hands make them natural problem-solvers within Kin Folk society. |
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/cerun-portrait.jpg][Cerun]] |__[[Cerun]]__ are graceful and peaceful, often taking on the role of caretakers for the forests and meadows surrounding their lands.  They are highly attuned to, and have an intuitive sense for, the ever changing and fluid nature of [[The Feywild]].  [[Cerun]] tend to be gentle and soft-spoken, favoring diplomacy and community building - preserving the natural order and tradition of [[The Feywild]]. |
| [>img[images/races/fey/kinfolk/broxxen-portrait.jpg][Broxxen]] |__[[Broxxen]]__ are fiercely determined and relentless in their efforts, embodying the hard-working spirit of The Kin Folk.  They are renown for their burrowing abilities, and construct elaborate underground homes and villages.  They often show a gruff exterior, and tend to prefer solitary lives; however they are fierce defenders of their community. |
[>img[images/organizations/the-knights-of-deepwater.jpg]]
The Knights Of Deepwater worship [[The Gods]] of [[Asha]] through service.  They strive to right wrongs, and defend the weak and unprotected.  Their base of operations is within the city walls of [[Deepwater]], close to the seat of power for [[The Divine Order]].  They protect and defend [[The Viridian Empire]].

!Code Of Honor
//Never break your word; Never defile [[The Gods]] or allow them to be defiled; Defend the weak and unprotected; Never raise your hand against a [[Priest]] or [[Knight]]; Never ignore an insult to yourself, the Knights, or anyone weaker than yourself; Take all pains and discomforts stoically and without apparent burden.//

!The Trials
Before becoming a [[Knight]], one must surpass four trials.  These tests harden and mold a person into what we know as a [[Knight]].  Each trial represents [[a God|The Gods]] of [[Asha]] and their teaching.  They are induced through many hours of meditation and physical manipulation of the body.  A master [[Knight]] must guide initiates through this process.
When a trial is successfully completed by an initiate, their spirit is enriched and their [[Soul]] grows stronger.  Often this results in a brief divination with the prospective [[God|The Gods]].  The Knights strongly believe that what is seen and experienced during the trial is for the traveler, and the traveler alone.  No questions are asked as to what was witnessed.  One major rule is to never undertake a trial alone, always the path must be traveled with a companion.

* ''__The Trial Of Qualok__'' is the understanding that there is not an answer to every question.  Even [[Qualok]] does not possess enough years to fully understand the workings of the universe, which plagues him.  This trial should force the [[Knight]] to admit they do not understand, or they do not know.
* ''__The Trial Of Lucian__'' is one of tranquility and harmony.  To traverse this trial, one must attune one’s [[Soul]] to [[The Gods]].  You must not allow your mind to cloud your [[Soul]], purify oneself with [[Lucian’s|Lucian]] wisdom.  This trial should force the [[Knight]] to help an enemy, or someone they hate and despise.
* ''__The Trial Of Kombar__'' is readiness.  Like [[Kombar]], one must prepare for the turmoil that all creatures must face.  A [[Knight]] never sees the end of this path, and continues to train until the day they become one with [[The Gods]].  This trial should test the limits of their battle experience.
* ''__The Trial Of Xander__''  tests the very limits of a [[Knight's|Knight]] training.  This is the most feared and brutal trial.  The pain and anguish caused by this test has broken many of individuals who have fallen from the Knighthood, unable to endure the sacrifice that [[Xander]] suffered.  This path should attempt to fatigue, confuse, and frighten the [[Knight]].

!Former Members
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/lionel-keelen-portrait.jpg][Lionel Keelen]] <br>[[Lionel Keelen]] |[[Lionel Keelen]] was a former [[Lord Commander]] that was swayed to join [[The Remnant]] and kill [[Emperor]] [[Jacob Jedaleon III]] in 1025 [[AAP]].  He was blinded by his hatred of [[The Orcish Race|Orc]], as he understood that [[Jacob Jedaleon III]] desired to accept portions of [[The Orcish Lands]] into [[The Viridian Empire]],  |
In [[The Dock Ward]] of the city of [[Zylok]] sits a strange shop that stands out from the others.  It has a deep purple facade, and in its window is a desiccated head of a [[Dathairä]].  A cloud of lavender scented purple smoke trails out of the shop door as one walks inside.  Every wall is painted purple, and every dusty knickknack on the shelves is dyed a deep violet.  The proprietor, a hairless [[Bairn]] who calls himself [[Nehga]] is fond of sitting cross legged on top of the counter smoking a pipe that is responsible for the lavender smoke.  He is hairless and quite old, wearing a plum colored robe.  His cheeks and forehead are decorated with nine painted eyes.

The desiccated [[Dathairä]] head is indeed real.  [[Nehga]] refers to it by name, which is also [[Nehga]] - but he is clear to point out the name is just coincidence.

His store is filled with trinkets (P160) of Players Handbook.  He sells them for 1d6 Silver each.
The Leap is the name of a large cascade of waterfalls in the city of [[Stomgar's Quarry]] in [[Kellos]] that flows over the canyon wall and down into a fresh water lake.

Once a year the city holds a competition which has contestants leaping from the waterfall’s crest, and diving down the length of the canyon into the deep pool at the foot.  The dive is not for the faint of heart, or for those that are not accomplished divers.

"The Lifting" is the name given to the event in 1021 [[AAP]] when the cities of [[Caldoria]] were raised from the bottom of the ocean.  The seven cities of [[Caldoria]] were protected from the crushing depths of the ocean from a magical dome.  This dome served as protection, but was beginning to deteriorate.  In 142 AAP the first breach was discovered.  A small hole that temporarily formed in the dome causing cold seawater to pour forth - it luckily closed on its own accord.  [[The Conclave Of Voices]], in order to calm the population suggested this was natural and no cause for alarm.  This was the prevailing belief for hundreds of years.  In 1001 [[AAP]], one [[Dragonborn]] named [[Xyvs]] began to study the breaches.  His analysis caused him to determine the breaches were increasing in both frequency and magnitude.  [[Xyvs]] calculated this would cause flooding and lead to the extinction of his society.  [[The Conclave Of Voices]] ignored him, thinking him foolish; and the general population continued to believe the breaches to be part of the natural cycle designed by its creators - bringing new air, water and life.

In 1021 [[AAP]] [[The Grey Companions]] on the maiden voyage of [[The Airship Triumph]] inadvertently discovered one of these breaches, when their ship was pulled down into a giant whirlpool.  To many [[Dragonborn]], their very existence proved the surface of [[Asha]] was hospitable and the fallibility of the [[The Conclave Of Voices]].

[[Kurga The Black]] was [[The Speaker Of The Conclave Of Voices|The Conclave Of Voices]], and had just recently killed the other [[Voices Of The Conclave|The Conclave Of Voices]] to slowly gain more power and control; the slow rot of [[Desecration]] reaching even under the ocean.  He was influenced by the [[Corruption]] of [[Blood Magic]], and contact with [[Dathairä]].
[>img[images/characters/ruje/liminal.jpg]]
The Liminal is a legendary and seemingly indestructible being of incredible power and strength who makes [[The Jungle|The Sorrow]] of [[Ruje]] its domain.  It is the primary deity of [[The Church Of The Final Atonement]].
While an [[Elf]] is blessed with eternal life, older elves undergo a sorrowful yearning to see [[The Fields Of Kalara]], the name given to reclaiming of spirit back to [[The Feywild]].  Symptoms include overwhelming sadness and depression, and a desire to remain solitary.  Advanced cases enter into a deep coma in which they become unresponsive and eventually die.
[>img[images/locations/ruje/tszanthus/the-lower-streap.jpg]]
The Lower Streap is a district located in the city of [[Tszanthus]] on the continent of [[Ruje]], known for its rough and dangerous reputation.  This densely populated area houses the city's poor and lower class.  Despite this, the people of The Lower Streap are characterized by a proud and strong sense of community.  Crime is rampant, and The Lower Streap is one of the oldest sections of [[Tszanthus]].  Despite the danger and poverty, life in The Lower Streap is full of a vibrant and thriving culture.

Much pride comes from the people of The Lower Streap that one of their own, [[Tauksana]], rose to the rank of [[Octarch]] of [[Tszanthus]], then later [[Primarch]] of [[The Hegemony]].

!Notable Characters and Groups
| [>img[images/characters/ruje/tszanthus/hermokrates-ernandosoro-portrait.jpg]] <br>[[Hermokrates Ernandosoro]] |[[Hermokrates Ernandosoro]] serves the [[Scion]] of [[The Lower Streap]], one of the oldest districts within the city known for its crime and poverty.  He is a large and kind man, known for his generosity towards both the townsfolk and those who have fallen on hard times.  He is naive, mistaking criminals for those down on their luck.  Despite his flaws, the people of [[The Lower Streap]] love him and even the criminal element secretly help him retain his position as [[Scion]].  He is married to [[Monoza Arama]].|
| [>img[images/characters/ruje/tszanthus/rubizkunde-echabarri-portrait.jpg]] <br>[[Rubizkunde Echabarri]] |[[Rubizkunde Echabarri]] is known simply as Ruby to her friends, a female innkeeper in [[The Lower Streap]] of Tszanthus.  She is a large, dark-skinned woman who is skilled in handling herself in rough company.  She is known for her establishment, "[[Ruby's Retreat]]", that serves as a haven for travelers and locals alike who are down on their luck.  Ruby is well-respected in [[The Lower Streap]] due to her ability to keep an orderly establishment.|
| [img[images/characters/ruje/tszanthus/gromm-steelbreaker-portrait.jpg][Gromm Steelbreaker]] <br> [[Gromm Steelbreaker]] |__[[Gromm Steelbreaker]]__ is the gruff and stoic leader of [[The Brotherhood]]. [[Gromm|Gromm Steelbreaker]] is a [[Duergar'Ran]] with a large beard that he keeps braided and adorned with beads. He is a skilled weapons dealer and is known to be fair in his dealings. However, he is not afraid to use violence when necessary to protect his interests.|
| [img[images/characters/ruje/tszanthus/wright-portrait.jpg][Wright]] <br> [[Wright]] |__[[Wright]]__ is a [[Tiefling]] who is a major power broker among the various entities of [[The Lower Streap]].  She owns and operates [[The Crucible]] as well as the famous establishment known as [[The Delver's Well]].  A shrewd business woman, she is largely motivated by vanity, ego and greed; but not enough to desire the complications that come from running a major organization. She is a fixture within [[The Lower Streap]]. |
| [img[images/characters/ruje/tszanthus/yagra-stonefist-portrait.jpg][Yagra Stonefist]] <br> [[Yagra Stonefist]] |__[[Yagra Stonefist]]__ is a [[Half-Orc]] freelance mercenary that is known to do odd jobs for [[The Brotherhood]].  Known for her rough demeanor, she enjoys wrestling in [[The Crucible]], and drinking to excess inside of [[The Delver's Well]] when she has the coin.  She prefers her time in [[The Lower Streap]], as she does not like being in the spotlight. |
| [img[images/characters/ruje/tszanthus/mirabelle-thorne-portrait.jpg][Mirabelle Thorne]] <br> [[Mirabelle Thorne]] |__[[Mirabelle Thorne]]__ is a [[Human]] female who is the current publisher of [[The Signal Post]], a broadside newspaper published in [[The Lower Streap]].  She is a skilled investigative journalist known for her passion for uncovering the hidden layers of [[Tszanthus]] society.  She inherited the paper from her late father, and seeks to make him proud. |

| [>img[images/organizations/tszanthus/the-little-lambs-preview.jpg]] <br>[[The Little Lambs]] |[[The Little Lambs]] are a collection of child urchins who survive through petty crimes of theft and pick-pocketing.  Many of them are orphans or abandoned by their families, and have turned to a life of crime to survive.  They are incredibly nimble and quick, and can often slip past even the most watchful guards sight unseen.  While they are generally not a threat to the city's more powerful criminal organizations, they are viewed as a nuisance by many shopkeepers and merchants in the city.  They are watched over by [[Mother Pidna]], an enigmatic crime boss. |
| [img[images/organizations/tszanthus/the-siphoners-preview.jpg][The Siphoners]] <br> [[The Siphoners]] |[[The Siphoners]] are a small gang who specialize in using minor [[Magic]] to aid their thievery.  They are often hired by other criminal organiztions to help with heists or to provide magical protection for their businesses.  While they are not particularly powerful individually, they are skilled at working together.  Their leader is known only by the name "[[The Weaver]]".  Little is known about [[The Weaver]], not even their gender or appearance.  Some rumors suggest that [[The Weaver]] may have studied under a powerful [[Wizard]] or [[Sorcerer]]. |
| [>img[images/organizations/tszanthus/the-brotherhood-preview.jpg]] <br>[[The Brotherhood]] |[[The Brotherhood]]'s leadership is nearly exclusively [[Dwarven|Dwarf]], having been a criminal organization which is said to have begun as a group of [[Dwarven|Dwarf]] blacksmiths who banded together to protect their business from rival gangs.  Over time, they fell into criminal activities themselves, and now control many of the weapon and armor shops within Tszanthus.  They specialize in weapons dealing, shop extortion, and prostitution and use their connections to extort both clients and workers.  Its members are composed of dredge and outcasts from The Lower Streap.  |

!Previous Organizations
| [img[images/characters/ruje/tszanthus/ronak-killa-portrait.jpg][The Sons Of Samedi]] <br> [[The Sons Of Samedi]] |[[The Sons Of Samedi]] was an upstart criminal gang in [[Tszanthus]] in the year  [[Hassomir]] 1268 or 1026 [[AAP]]. They were [[Yuan-Ti]] infiltrators, genetically modified to pass as [[Human]], spreading a drug known as [[Samedi's Kiss]], in order to subdue the populace and kidnap citizens to fuel rituals for [[Zumma Ezzoh]] on the mainland of [[Ruje]].  They were stopped by [[The Thieves]]; who followed their trail to put an end to [[Zumma Ezzoh]]. |


!Notable Locations
* [[The Rose And Thorn]] - a restaurant and taproom rumored to be owned by the [[Primarch]] herself, as well as the leader of the [[Bregan Datha]].  The proprietor is [[Ash]], a red-skinned [[Saurial]] with the head of a [[T-rex]]. 
* [[The Old Docks|The Old Docks Of Tszanthus]] - Ironically, [[The Old Docks|The Old Docks Of Tszanthus]] are one of the newest additions to The Lower Streap, having been rebuilt as the previous docks were falling apart from disrepair.  It is a common occurrence for the townspeople to confuse "The New Old Docks" and "The Old Old Docks". 
* [[Ruby's Retreat]] - A popular Inn operated by [[Rebizkunde Echabarri]], known affectionately as "Ruby".  The establishment is known for its friendly, family atmosphere and is thought to be the heart of The Lower Streap.  it doubles as an orphanage where [[Ruby|Rebizkunde Echabarri]] takes in small children who help with the day-to-day maintenance of the inn.
* [[The Rusty Anchor]] - A rough and tumble tavern where only the bravest or foolish dare to venture.  Located near [[The Old Docks|The Old Docks Of Tszanthus]], it caters to [[Kuo-Toa]] sailors and travelers.  The bar is made from dark hardwood and runs the length of the room.  Its walls are adorned with cheap knick-knacks and souvenirs brought back from sea voyages.  The air is thick with the smell of salty sea spray and cheap liquor.  The barmaids here are known for their toughness, and take no nonsense from anyone.  It has a reputation for where deals are made and secrets are traded.
* [[The Crucible]] - A fight club operated by a charismatic [[Tiefling]] known as [[Wright]].  Visitors wager on clandestine fights which are often regulated boxing matches.  For those looking for a bit more excitement, [[Wright]] operates an underground version known as [[The Pit]] which offers less rules but can be difficult to find if you don't have the right connections.
* [[The Delver's Well]] - A feasthall on the edge of The Lower Streap, owned by [[Wright]] that is popularized by the large pit in the center of the establishment which boasts the only publicly available entry into [[The Undercity|The Undercity Of Tszanthus]].  This makes [[The Delver's Well]] an attraction for many across [[Tszanthus]] from all walks of life and stations, eager to see another set of adventurers (or "delvers") make their way underneath.
* [[The Den]] - Short ceilings and small furniture mark this tavern as a location that caters to [[Dwarf]] and [[Goblin]] patrons.  It is run by [[Maero]] a muscular and tattooed [[Half-Dwarf|Darkling]]; and it is known by many that this is the headquarters for [[The Brootherhood], a gang of weapons dealers.
* [[The Trivardum]] - A large slate-shinged building that houses all sorts of merchants.  Each week, merchants from across the city (from all stations) come here to buy items that they sell in their own shops.  As it caters to merchants, it is full of vibrant "fresh off the boat" spices, fresh foods and exotic goods.  One of the few honest livings in The Lower Streap is to be found here.
* [[The Dusk Market]] - For hard to find items and contraband that can't be sold at [[The Trivardum]], a wandering bazaar known as [[The Dusk Market]] springs up the night following the weekly sales at [[The Trivardum]].  One can not only find drugs, poisons, and strange creatures; but also discounts on stolen goods or items sailors wish to unload rather than bring back on their voyage.  It can be dangerous to shop [[The Dusk Market]], as the characters here are unsavory and what you see is what you get.
* [[The Double Bubble Flower Fresh]] is a laundromat run by a [[Duergar'Ran]] woman named [[Simea Opalbraid]].  Old and stern, [[Simea Opalbraid]] runs the establishment with a contingent of young [[Dwarven|Dwarf]] girls who she organizes like a small army.  She is known to take in laundry from all over the city.
* [[Dragontail Alley]] is one of the oldest sections of the city, where the remnants of [[The Rose And Thorn]] can be found.
[>img[images/organizations/the-magian-imperium-symbol.jpg]]
{{quote{
//"For The Benefit Of All"//
''-The Motto Of The Magian Imperium''
}}}
The Magian Imperium is an illustrious yet infamously bureaucratic organization within [[The Viridian Empire]], founded by [[Thalos Viridian]] in 11 [[AAP]] to preserve and protect the populace from misuse of [[Magic]].  Once an organization that advanced the [[Arcane]] arts, it has since devolved into yet another means for wealthy nobles to gain political prestige by monopolizing and regulating [[Magic]].  The organization is characterized by rampant bureaucracy, corruption, and favoritism; valuing profit and influence over genuine magical talent or dedication.  While The Magian Imperium presents itself as the protector of [[Magical|Mage]] Order, its true power lies in its stranglehold on the [[Arcane]] economy and its influence over the political elite.

!Origin & Priority
The chief priority of these powerful arcane specialists is to protect [[The Viridian Empire]] from the rampant misuse of [[Magic]].  The organization was commanded into existence by [[Emperor]] [[Thalos Viridian]] after he ended his father's [[Azutan Nagyos]] or "War On Magic".  Within [[The Viridian Empire]] all [[Wizards|Wizardry]] are required to swear [[The Oath Of The Magian Imperium|Magian Imperium License]] and relinquish a small sample of blood within a [[Sanguilacrum]] that can be used to track down errant magic users.

!Exclusivity And Grandeur
The highest ranks within The Magian Imperium operate under extreme exclusivity and grandeur.  Membership is highly coveted by the nobility because it bestows immense status and privileges, including access to high courts, [[Magical Components]], and occasionally a voice in royal decisions.  Aspiring members pay exorbitant donations to the existing leadership, and all [[Wizards|Wizard]] and [[Sorcerers|Sorcery]] of [[The Empire|The Viridian Empire]] are forced to pay dues for the privilege of wielding [[Magic]]; all of this ensuring the organization's continued lavish lifestyle.

!State Sponsored Magic
The Magian Imperium controls state-sponsored [[Teleportation Circles|Teleportation Circle]], ensuring fast and efficient travel between major cities - for a steep fee.  These [[circles|Teleportation Circle]] are a cornerstone of trade, diplomacy, and governance.  Simultaneously, all practitioners of [[Magic]] are required to obtain a [[License|Magian Imperium License]].  Those found practicing without a license are harshly punished, fined into ruin, or conscripted into the Imperium's service.  The Magian Imperium guards its secrets jealously, holding patents on powerful [[alchemical|Alchemy]] formulas.

At the lowest levels, the organization operates as a bloated bureaucracy.  Low-ranking clerks and inspectors - many of whom obtained their positions through nepotism or familial connections - work at a sluggish pace, treating their jobs as cushy, lifelong appointments.  To them, doing the bare minimum is not just a habit, its an unspoken rule of survival in The Imperium.  Interactions with these low-level functionaries often leave citizens frustrated by their rudeness, inefficiency, and blatant sense of entitlement.  Yet, securing one of these positions is seen as a mark of privilege, as entry into the Imperium - even at the lowest level - requires connections or bribes that only the well-placed can afford.

The Magian Imperium is both a source of ridicule and a symbol of the decadence of [[the aristocracy|Houses Of The Viridian Empire]] of [[The Viridian Empire]].  To the common folk, they are a reminder of the disconnect between the ruling elite and the everyday struggles of the people.  To [[Mages|Wizardry]], they are a mockery of the craft, prioritizing wealth and status over the pursuit of knowledge.

!History Of Greatness
The Magian Imperium was not always the bloated, bureaucratic machine it is today.  In its earliest days, the organization was the pinnacle of [[Arcane]] brilliance and innovation, staffed by some of the most gifted [[Magicians|Magic]] [[The Empire|The Viridian Empire]] had ever known.  These were visionaries, individuals who dedicated their lives to unraveling the secrets of the universe and bending them to [[Humanity's|Human]] will.  The patents that The Magian Imperium cling to so tightly were derived from these great minds.  However, as the centuries passed and the original innovators gave way to administrators and profiteers, the organization's priorities shifted from discovery to control.  What was once a symbol of [[Human]] ingenuity has become a gilded cage, yet its history of greatness still echoes through [[The Empire's|The Viridian Empire]] accomplishments.

Occasionally, a member with genuine talent emerges, but such individuals are rare and often find themselves stifled by their inability to thrive in the political maneuvering at the highest levels of the organization.  This occurs enough that The Magian Imperium has secured its space in the psyche of many for being an institution of intellect and innovation, even though it is not always seen overtly.

!Disbandment Or Reform
Critics of The Magian Imperium call for its disbandment or reform, arguing that its current state undermines [[The Empire's|The Viridian Empire]] potential for [[Arcane]] advancement.  However, such efforts face staunch opposition from [[the nobility|Houses Of The Viridian Empire]], who view the organization as a vital tool for consolidating power.  As long as gold continues to flow, The Magian Imperium will remain a fixture of [[The Viridian Empire's|The Viridian Empire]] political and [[Magical|Magic]] landscape, for better or worse.

!Relationship With The Grand Fellowship Of Mages
The Magian Imperium has a complicated relationship with [[The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]], a venerable organization dedicated to the open sharing and advancement of [[Arcane]] knowledge.  While [[The Fellowship|The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]] holds itself to the highest standards of scholarship and [[Magical|Magic]] ethics, the Magian Imperium views members with disdain, perceiving their methods pretentious and impractical.  This disdain manifests in a one-sided rivalry, with The Magian Imperium often attempting to undermine or discredit [[The Fellowship|The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]].  They spread rumors of [[The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]] elitism and accuse them of hoarding knowledge for their own benefit.  In contrast, [[The Fellowship|The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]] largely ignores the antics of The Imperium.

!The Lyceum
[[The Lyceum]] is the headquarters of The Magian Imperium located in the city of [[Deepwater]], however major cities often have at least one member present.  Anyone found to be practicing [[Magic]] is logged and checked up on routinely, as misuse of [[Magic]] is grounds for arrest.  Drops of blood from every [[Mage|Magic]] that is licensed to practice [[Magic]] are stored in [[Sanguilacrum]] - each kept within an undisclosed location within [[The Lyceum]] known as [[Titanpointe]].

!Departments
* [[The Department of Magical Transportation]]
* [[The Department of Magical Law Enforcement]]
* [[The Department of Magical Accidents and Catastrophes]]
* [[The Department of Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures]]

!Ranks
* [[Lord Magister]] - the highest rank within the Imperium.
* [[Constable]] - agents of the department of magical law enforcement, Constables have the ability to license new users of magic, swearing them to [[The Oath Of The Magian Imperium|Magian Imperium License]].  They are also protectors and governance of a designated area.
* [[Inquisitor]] - those who track down and stop errant magic users

!Notable Magisters
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/the-magian-imperium/saldrith-greenwood-portrait.jpg][Saldrith Greenwood]] <br>[[Saldrith Greenwood]] |__[[Saldrith Greenwood]]__ is the current [[Lord Magister]] of The Magian Imperium.  A shrewd politician with a sharp tongue, [[Saldrith|Saldrith Greenwood]] rose to power through his unparalleled ability to navigate the treacherous waters of court intrigue.  Though many others best him at [[Spellcraft|Magic]], his charisma and cunning make him a formidable figure.  [[Saldrith|Saldrith Greenwood]] was once first in line to assume the mantle of head of [[House Greenwood]], though he spares no expense in hiding why he is not currently in that role.|
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/the-magian-imperium/calistra-galdmoore-portrait.jpg][Calistra Galdmoore]] <br>[[Calistra Galdmoore]] |__[[Calistra Galdmoore]]__ is a child of the wealthy merchant family that heads [[The Gilded Compass]].  [[Lady]] [[Calistra|Calistra Galdmoore]] bought her way into The Magian Imperium with an unheard-of sum and is now head of [[The Department of Magical Transportation]].  She uses her position to expand [[her family's trade empire|The Gilded Compass]], wielding her title as a tool of intimidation.  Her [[Magical|Magic]] abilities are limited to basic [[Charms]], though she insists on being addressed as an expert in the [[Arcane]].  Though she is young, her lust for power is unrivaled.|
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/the-magian-imperium/dorian-yount-portrait.jpg][Dorian Yount]] <br>[[Dorian Yount]] |__[[Dorian Yount]]__ was once the prize attendant of [[Lord Magister]] [[Greenwood|Saldrith Greenwood]], though a dispute over the trajectory of The Magian Imperium has led to him becoming timid and scorned.  [[Dorian|Dorian Yount]] is one of the few members with [[Magical|Magic]] talent mirroring the origin of The Imperium, though he rarely has time to put it to use.  Instead, he spends his days attending to [[The Menagerie|The Menagerie Of The Magian Imperium]] and to [[The Department of Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures]]; finding any excuse to stay out of the watchful eye of [[Lord Magister]] [[Greenwood|Saldrith Greenwood]].|

!Previous Members
| [img[images/characters/Waywill/waywill-portrait.jpg][Waywill]] <br> [[Waywill]] |__[[Waywill]]__ was appointed by [[Emperor]] [[Cyril Viridian]] as the first [[Lord Magister]] of The Magian Imperium.  He was skilled in both [[Wizardry]] and [[Primal]] [[Magic]], and formed the foundation of [[The Menagerie Of The Magian Imperium]] that is the cornerstone of [[The Department of Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures]]. |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/the-magian-imperium/elion-drevis-portrait.jpg][Elion Drevis]] <br>[[Elion Drevis]] |__[[Elion Drevis]]__ was a prominent [[Lord Magister]] of The Magian Imperium, known for his experiments with [[Planar Magic|The Planes Of Existence]].  [[Elion|Elion Drevis]] sought to develop new ways of harnessing the power of [[The Astral Stream]].  However, a catastrophic mishap during one of his rituals resulted in the permanent exile of his whole research team into [[The Astral Stream]].  While officially declared deceased, scholars posit that fragments of their consciousness could still be lingering in [[The Astral Stream]].|
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-keep/deepwater/lysandra-jedaleon-portrait.jpg][Lysandra Jedaleon]] <br>[[Lysandra Jedaleon]] |__[[Lysandra Jedaleon]]__ was a prominent [[Inquisitor]] of The Magian Imperium, and her position allowed her to ascend the social ladder, ultimately marrying [[Emperor]] [[Althar Velorith]] in 732 [[AAP]].  Her charm and cunning earned her a prominent role in court politics, where she became key advisor to the [[Emperor]].  Though her [[Magical|Magic]] talents were modest, her political acumen solidified her legacy as one of the most influential figures of her time.  After her husband's death, she assumed the full responsibility of [[The Empire|The Viridian Empire]]. |
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-isles/zylok/the-athenaeum/nester-arkwood/nester-arkwood-portrait.jpg][Nester Arkwood]] <br> [[Nester Arkwood]] |__[[Nester Arkwood]]__ son of [[Tilden Arkwood]] and [[Cassandra Huntley]], [[Zylokian|Zylok]] [[Arkanus First Class]], [[Distinguished Magus]] of [[The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]], [[Lord Magister]] of The Magian Imperium. Former Professor and Headmaster of [[The Athenaeum]], he was known as one of the most powerful [[wizards|Wizardry]] in the world.  He had little time to devote to the duties of [[Lord Magister]], and delegated most of the operation to [[Magister]] [[Saldrith Greenwood]].  Under [[Arkwood's|Nester Arkwood]] watchful eye, The Magian Imperium was more open with its view - and contributed [[Enchantment]] to [[The Viridian Empire]]. |
The Man on the Mount is the largest mountain formation in the desert.  It is plainly seen from the city streets of [[Akabele-ethu]].  The summit of the Man on the Mount has been home to generations of Akbelethian holy men.  Ancient hermits and mystics have carved hovels out of the living rock.  They live in abject poverty and total isolation.

Pilgrims travel the hash and rugged terrain to parlay with the current wise sage of the mountain.
The Material Plane is one of [[The Planes Of Existence]]; what is understood to be one of [[The Echo Planes]] that house [[Valouria's|Valouria]] body.  Scholars have come to call this area "The Prime Material Plane" or simply "Prime".

!The Crossroads Of The Multiverse
It is the plane in which the planet [[Asha]] and its surrounding cosmos exists.  The Prime Material Plane is the only means to connect to the other [[Echo Planes|The Echo Planes]], as well as [[The Fountains Of Creation]].  This causes The Prime to occupy an important position as a crossroads of the multiverse, and all other planes being defined in relation to it.

!Theories Of Multiple Primes
Some scholars theorize that there are an infinite number of Material Planes.  Each branching with different timelines and events that connect only in the slightest of similarities.
[>img[images/organizations/tszanthus/the-medica.jpg]]
{{quote{
//The greatest weapon in the world is the human mind.  Use it wisely.//
''-Unknown, proverb of The Medica''
}}}
The Medica Of [[Tszanthus]] is an organization found throughout the continent of [[Ruje]], that once held a monopoly on [[Human]] immortality through their perfection of a process known as [[The Sacrament]].  [[The Sacrament]] was an invasive medical procedure whose process was closely guarded by The Medica.  It had the ability to extend life indefinitely, causing the subject's skin to acquire a bluish hue after taking a number of treatments.  This process was destroyed and disrupted in 1026 [[AAP]] when the [[Apotheon]] [[Samuanya]] cursed it never to work again.

The power of The Medica is vast, built upon the wealth and influence generated from their monopoly of [[The Sacrament]].  Even after the ending of [[The Sacrament]], the organization remains one of the most powerful in [[Ruje]], with deep ties and influence into the government.  While financially out of reach for the average citizen of [[Ruje]], The Medica is one of the most well respected organizations, as The Medica are perceived as generous in their advancements in health and wellness.

Those with training call themselves [[Physicers|Physicer]], and guard their secrets with fervor.

!The Secret Of Galvanic Rebirth
The Medica's process was made possible through the study that [[Galvandra]] made in [[The Third Age]].  She was a [[Druid]] in the service of [[The Whispered One]] who conducted medical experiments that while unethical was considered the most comprehensive study of the mechanics of the living body.  While her procedures are considered crude and immoral, her groundbreaking analysis is still taught today, making her an honorary first Medica.  Due to her questionable past, these origins are a closely guarded secret that only those in positions of authority within The Medica are privy to.

!Baldarrain University and The Crockery
In [[Orphillion]] 23 (263 [[IO]]), [[Erasmus Baldarrain]] founded [[Baldarrain University]], which later became the cornerstone and defacto headquarters of The Medica.  Here, modern research into [[The Sacrament]] is performed - perfecting the serum and process.  Later, [[The White Garden Asylum For The Mentally Insane]] (known to the citizens of [[Tszanthus]] simply as [[The Crockery]]) was constructed - an institution dedicated to the rehabilitation and research of those whose minds have been shattered due to exposure of the [[Highstorm]].

!Contributions to society
Throughout the generations, The Medica have performed experiments that pushed the boundaries of science and medicine.  While their practices on the sick, dying and destitute lower class have been morally questionable, they have led to startling breakthroughs in the study of anatomy, [[The Soul|Soul]] and the understanding of health and wellness.

* [[Ereshkigal Delondra]] experimented with the effects of a substance he named [[Ammenox]], which aided in in blood coagulation and wound closure.  Many of his patience were subjected to torturous and painful wounds for him to properly develop his serum.  [[Ammenox]] is commonly available in [[Ruje]] as a healing tablet or serum which can be applied to those who have suffered grievous wounds.
The Memoirs Of Hagen Hairfoot is an autobiographical [[book|Books and Literature]] written in 25 [[AAP]] by [[Hagen Hairfoot]], a [[Bairn]] [[Bard]].  He was an adventurer of some renown who lived in the city of [[Zylok]] during the formation of [[The Viridian Empire]]. 

His memoirs are composed across multiple volumes, each containing tall tales that make for exciting reading.  He lived during the [[Azutan Nagyos]] and played a roll alongside the founders of [[The Athenaeum]] and [[The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]].  He was a good friend to [[Waywill]], [[Armondax]], [[Mysara]], and [[Fazar]] - and sang of their greatness and contribution.

Some of his most fanciful tales in the books include [[Mysara]] traveling [[The Planes Of Existence]] through [[The Mirror Of Resplendence]] made of liquefied [[Mana]], [[The Grand Fellowship Of Mages]] raising [[The Athenaeum]] from dirt using the power of [[Magic]], and tales of [[Hagen Hairfoot]] and how he walked the length of [[The Viridian Empire]] four times over.  His most exciting tale was how he cheated death itself.
The Mirror Of Resplendence is a hidden and lost section of [[The Athenaeum]], built by the original founders.  The mirror itself is made from a rippling pool of liquid [[Mana]], and housed within an ornate brass and gold housing of clockwork, with crystal lenses used to focus [[Leyline|Leylines]] energy.

!The Trials
Each of the founders placed a trial in front of the mirror, to protect it from intrusion.  Only those strong of [[Magic]] and of will can succeed at the trials.
* ''The Trial Of [[Waywill Lifehealer|Waywill]]'' - This trial is a room with an 8x8 [[Dragon Chess]] board.  The only way through the room to the door on the other side is to walk across the board.  Once one steps on the board, they are magically compelled through force to move like the piece that corresponds to the square they entered on.  An opposing chess piece on the opposite side of the board makes the same moves.  If their piece is taken, they are removed to the starting side of the room.
* ''The Trial Of [[Fazar]]'' - This room is a grand room of marble, with ornate stone statues of warriors covering every inch of the walls and grand pillars.  A large set of locked double doors are the only exit.  The doors cannot be magically unlocked, and every casting of a spell brings one statue to life to attack the intruder.
* ''The Trial Of [[Armondax]]'' - After descending stairs and passing through a set of metal doors there is a small nondescript room of smooth grey stone.  The walls are slightly blackened at the base.  Upon entering the room, the doors close behind and flames engulf the walls and floor.  There is a sound of grinding stone and a small opening only a few inches in diameter is seen in the flames.  If one reaches their hand inside, there is a lever to shut off the flames and reveal another set of stairs downward.
* ''The Trial Of [[Mysara]]'' - The final and most brutal of tests.  The room appears as a natural cavern that snakes in a serpentine pattern.  The walls have large sections of rough mirror shared embedded within them, creating hundreds of reflected images.  A heavy set of doors bars the way.  Observant individuals will notice there is no torches within the room, despite there being light.  Instead, the torch is seen in one of the mirrors, hanging next to the exit door in the mirror version of the room.  Touching a mirror causes the person's mirror version of themselves to pull them through the mirror to fight.  Removing the torch and placing it in the real world holder will open the door.

!The Guardian
| [img[images/characters/kellos/the-isles/zylok/the-athenaeum/tyranthrax-portrait.jpg][Tyranthrax]] <br> [[Tyranthrax]] |__[[Tyranthrax]]__ was appointed by [[Mysara]] as a guardian of the mirror.  A [[Beholder]], [[Tyranthrax]] has lived within the proximity of the mirror for over 1,000 years - and like many of his kind is mildly insane and schizophrenic.  [[Tyranthrax]], however, is enthralled by the power of the mirror - and seeks to catalog it's workings and behavior. |
The Moonsea is the name of the expanse of water that sits between the mainland of [[Ruje]] and [[The Freeholds Of The Hegemony|The Hegemony]] that perch upon [[The Crescent Archipelago]].  The Moonsea region is as vibrant and diverse as it is dangerous.  The waters of The Moonsea are treacherous and equally as savage as [[Ruje's|Ruje]] infamous jungles.  Both the jungles and the sea are teaming with ferocious beasts, [[fierce storms|Highstorm]], and legendary monsters.  It is due to these facts that [[Ruje]] is regarded as one of the most dangerous and untamed places in all of [[Asha]].

!The Menagerie Coast
The coast of The Moonsea is known as [[The Menagerie Coast]].  It is home to [[The Freeholds Of The Hegemony|The Hegemony]], cities who have carved an existence out of the savage land.  The Moonsea is a harsh mistress, and only [[the fish-folk|Kuo-Toa]] known as the [[Kuo-Toa]] have the skill to navigate it safely.  They hold this monopoly with an iron fin, and no ships safely sail The Moonsea without a [[Kuo-Toan Wind Finder]] at the helm.  [[The Moonsea]] remains a mystery to outsiders, with only the bravest or most foolhardy of sailors being able to make the harsh journey to the northern tip of [[The Crescent|The Crescent Archipelago]]; the city of [[Akar]].
The Mummers are led by whomever bears the title of [[The Salt King]].  [[The Salt King]] rules from The Mummer's stronghold of [[Grimstone]], located within [[The Risen Reef]] off of the eastern coast of [[Amon]].  As the de facto ruler of The Mummers, [[The Salt King]] commands the numerous pirates and ships - seeing that their basic system of law and order is maintained.  In the event of a major dispute between two or more Mummers pertaining to the breaking of the law, their case is brought before [[The Salt King]] at which point the parties argue their cases and [[The Salt King]] makes judgement accordingly.  If one party is found to be at fault, depending on the severity of the offense, the offending party may be sentenced to pay some form of restitution to the offending party or may even be put to death if [[The Salt King]] deems it suitable.

!The Code Of The Mummers
* ''The Code Of Civility'' - no Mummer shall strike another aboard their ship or upon the soil of [[Grimstone]]; every dispute is settled by duel on the command of the quartermaster.  He who draws first blood shall be declared the victor.
* ''The Rite Of Parlay'' - when invoking this right, one has temporary protection from harm until granted an audience with the enemy captain.  Parley is not considered concluded until said captive and captain have completed negotiations.
* ''The Honor of the Escudo'' - the [[Escudo]] is a steel coin minted by The Mummers.  It is less of a form of currency and more of a form of respect, the currency of relationships.
* ''The Don't Hunt Our Own'' - The Mummers don't steal from one another.  Knowingly targeting other pirate ships is forbidden.  Respect your fellows in all accounts.
* ''Mercy To Those Who Ask'' - killing a surrendered enemy is not allowed.  The mercy of The Mummers shall not be overlooked.
* ''No Games Of Chance'' - no Mummer shall game for money; either with dice or cards
* ''Sharing of the spoils'' - all crew of a vessel share equally in the plunder.  The captain and first mate are entitled to double share, and one share is kept for [[The Salt King]].  Whomever spotted the ship/plunder gets first pick.

!Known Members
| [img[images/characters/amon/rafail-kallides-portrait.jpg][Rafail Kallides]] <br> [[Rafail Kallides]] |__[[Rafail "The Worm" Kallides|Rafail Kallides]]__ is [[The Salt King]], leader of the faction.  He is equally charming as he is brutal, and rules the organization with an iron fist.  He dabbles in [[Blood Magic]], using it to grant him a supernatural advantage.  He has the respect of many in The Mummers, and is a formidable and cunning pirate. |
| [img[images/characters/amon/bloody-maggie-portrait.jpg][Bloody Maggie]] <br> [[Bloody Maggie]] |__[[Bloody Maggie]]__ is a legendary pirate of The Mummers with an intense love of the sea and her vessel [[The Maiden]], who she speaks about as if it is her daughter.  She often seeks out dangerous missions, and has earned her moniker due to members of her crew often ending up dead.|
| [img[images/characters/amon/crafton-mane-portrait.jpg][Crafton Mane]] <br> [[Crafton Mane]] |__[[Crafton Mane, "The Gentleman"|Crafton Mane]]__ does not fit the mold of a stereotypical pirate.  He is jolly, personable, and incredibly polite to those he swindles.  Known as 'The Gentleman', he customarily leaves his victims with some form of gift or recompense for his robbery.  Many speak of just how downright pleasant it was to be his victim.|
| [img[images/characters/amon/tasarla-drace-portrait.jpg][Tasarla Drace]] <br> [[Tasarla Drace]] |__[[Tasarla Drace, "The Serpent"|Tasarla Drace]]__ is the captain of the ship [[The Blood Serpent]], notorious for her relentlessness.  When she sets her sights on something, she finds a way to achieve it no matter the cost.  She is a cunning swindler, and has connections in every port across [[The Risen Reef]].|

!Previous Members
| [img[images/characters/amon/caxton-loom-portrait.jpg][Caxton Loom]] <br> [[Caxton Loom]] |__[[Caxton "The Mongrel" Loom|Caxton Loom]]__ was a former [[Salt King|The Salt King]], deposed and made into a [[Zombie]] as punishment by [[Rafail Kallides]] as retribution for his despicable leadership of The Mummers.  His son [[Whyenne Loom]] used his newfound power as an [[Apotheon]] to return his father's soul and gave up life as an [[Apotheon]] so that he could live with and redeem his father.|
[>img[images/darkones/the-old-ones/the-nameless.jpg]]

The Nameless is an extraterrestrial entity, considered one of [[The Elder Gods]].  It is seen as a blinding rainbow of seething, feeling, reaching, and scintillating chromaticism of light.

It is the leading candidate of scholars as being [[The One True God]] that is credited as the creator of [[Humans|Human]], and some believe it is [[The Creator]] itself.
The NerteTine ("The Nine Lights" in [[Elvish]]) is the name given to the nine [[Taeleira]] who remained behind to lead [[The Sylvan Empire]] after the [[Elves|Elf]] came of age.  It was [[Zezebazum]] who attempted to corrupt them, converting them to [[Kiraga]].
[>img[images/organizations/uskard/the-nissido-dynasty.jpg]]
The Nissido Dynasty (8 IO – present) stands as the dominant martial and political power of [[Uskard]], uniting fractious [[Claves|Uskardeen Claves]] beneath the iron will of the [[Oni]] [[Chitan]], [[Haamnaa Srozzen]]. In an arrangement known as a [[Chitanate|Chitan]], while the crowned [[Koti]] of [[Uskard]] is granted some power, it is the [[Chitan]] who holds the true reins of authority, commanding his [[Muhari]], dictating policy, and shaping the cultural landscape of the realm secretly from behind the throne.

!Origin
The dynasty traces its roots three years after [[The Mourning]], when powerful [[Blood Magic]] fractured the lands of [[Uskard]]. In that chaos, [[Haamnaa Srozzen]] was given life, a towering [[Oni]] [[Chitan]] forged by [[The Cowled Wizards]] from the remnants of the past, his essence drawn from the flesh of ancient [[Muhari]], [[Chitan]], and [[Koti]] of [[The Thesilian People]].  He embodied a brutal nostalgia for [[Uskard’s|Uskard]] lost age of strength, and through brutal campaigns and shrewd alliances, he crushed [[Clave|Uskardeen Claves]] after [[Clave|Uskardeen Claves]], binding the scattered people beneath his banner.

After [[The Destruction of Uskard]], [[Haamnaa Srozen]] proclaimed himself the savior of a [[fractured realm|Uskardeen Claves]], publicly casting blame upon [[The Zmejskala Sovereignty]] for the devastation and chaos that followed. His ambitions were shackled by the cruel truth that, though created from the flesh of [[The Thesilian People]], his blood was impure by the standards he fervently preached. Determined to anoint a [[Koti]] of unblemished [[Thesilian Blood|The Theselian People]], he began a relentless search for those who still carried the ancestral lineage. Yet [[Srozen|Haamnaa Srozen]] found only disappointment; the surviving bloodline fell woefully short of his lofty ideals.

!Governance & Structure
The government of [[Uskard]] is a finely tuned hierarchy built upon rigid titles and duty, where each role serves a critical function in maintaining the dynasty’s control. At the apex are the [[Kot]]i, [[Chitan]], [[Muhari]], and [[Bezimen|The Bezimen]], each embodying distinct spheres of political, military, and regional power bound by millenia-old traditions.  While the populace may recognize the authority of these offices, the inner workings of their relationships, loyalty, and the secretive chains of command remain hidden.

The [[Koti]] functions as the dynasty’s prime minister and ceremonial head of state, meeting foreign dignitaries, signing treaties, and managing the daily workings of government. Descended from [[Shihab Nissido]], all [[Koti]] bear the [[Nissido bloodline|The Blood]], and each is meticulously groomed by [[Srozzen|Haamnaa Srozen]] from birth. They are rarely seen in public; only appearing behind a veil, even while traveling in by palanquin. Despite their title and heritage, the [[Koti]] are ultimately dependent on the [[Chitan]], not by design, but by the inherent weakness of their blood and mind.  Where the [[Koti]] is, the [[Chitan]] looms like a shadow. [[Srozen|Haamnaa Srozen]] controls their lives, which includes forbidding marriage, choosing mates, and raising the next generation personally to preserve purity. Though the [[Chitan]] may sometimes be disappointed in them, there is an undeniable bond of loyalty and affection, as they were raised under the [[Chitan’s|Chitan]] direct guidance.

The [[Chitan]] is the true power behind the throne, a military ruler who enforces the dynasty’s will with absolute authority. [[Srozen|Haamnaa Srozen]] is an immortal [[Oni]], and the singular [[Chitan]].  He commands the [[Bezimen|The Bezimen]], the dynasty’s elite army and secret police, loyal only to him.  With influence over the [[Koti]], the [[Chitan]] serves both as a father figure and the ultimate arbiter of policy. Unseen by the public, the identity of the [[Chitan]] is a closely guarded secret, known only to the [[Koti]]. Any who discover it are executed without hesitation. [[Srozen’s|Haamnaa Srozen]] ultimate goal is the eventual dissolution of The [[Chitinate|Chitan]] and the [[Bezimen|The Bezimen]] once he deems the [[Koti]] worthy.

The [[Muhari]] are the highest-ranking officers of the [[Bezimen|The Bezimen]]. Each [[Bezimen|The Bezimen]] is never seen without their helmet and armor.  The helmet is affixed with a permanent mask, either angelic for internal governance, or demonic for military operations.  Each [[Muhari]] adheres strictly to the [[Alqisi Muharim]], the sacred Oath of the [[Muhari]], which governs both conduct and law.  The [[Muhari]] are local generals, each stationed within a region or city.  Loyal to the [[Chitan]] above all else, they enforce the dynasty’s will in every corner of [[Uskard]], ensuring that rebellion, heresy, or impurity never goes unpunished.  While often benign, the [[Bezimen|The Bezimen]] stalk the streets, and promptly deal with those that go against the narrow needs of the [[Chitan]].

Local [[Kralots|Kralot]] are elected by the populace as leaders of [[Claves|Uskardeen Claves]] and cities.  The Dynasty permits a local [[Kralot]] much freedom to govern to the unique needs of their [[Clave|Uskardeen Claves]], with unique customs, laws, practices and traditions tailored to the local people.  Knitting the culture together is [[The Way]], a unifying philosophy and [[religious belief|Religion]] that guides and shapes [[Uskradeen|Uskard]] society.  Only a [[Muhari]] can override the will of a [[Kralot]].

!Culture
[[The Bezimen]] retain tight control over parts of the [[Culture]] of [[Uskard]].  All [[Tieflings|Tiefling]] and half-races born in [[Uskard]] are captured or killed by [[The Bezimen]]. They show strictness and lack of mercy in the process.  Those who follow the law have no fear, but those who step our of line are punished mercilessly.
[>img[images/maps/continents/kellos/the-northlands.jpg]]
The Northlands is mountainous and rugged, like it's people. It was the final region of [[Kellos]] to be added to [[The Viridian Empire]], through conquest of the [[Kells|Kell]].  Ruled by [[House Karbold]], who descend from the [[Kellish|Kell]] people who once inhabited the land.

The Northlands are a sweeping expanse of ice storm-lashed coasts, boreal forests, and wind-scoured highlands that form the northern crown of [[Kellos]].  Though harsh and often unforgiving, these lands carry an ancient majesty for the people here, as they were once the roaming grounds of [[The First Men]]; [[Humans|Human]] who weathered the worst of [[The Cataclysm]] of [[The Second Age]].  Modern [[Northmen]] are the cultural descendants, shaped by countless generations of survival, honor and deeply rooted tradition.  Winters here are long and dark, and the land itself seems to test those who live upon it.  Yet the region is rich in natural beauty; crystalline fjords, mountains that catch the first light of dawn, and ancient stone circles erected by [[The First Men]] whose purposes are only half-remembered.  Wild [[Beasts|Beast]], some mundane, some [[Monstrous|Monstrosity]] roam freely, keeping even seasoned hunters wary.

!The Northmen
The civilized [[Northmen]] blend the fierce independence of [[The First Men]] with the [[Culture]] and structure of [[The Viridian Empire]].  They hold tightly to customs, oaths sworn under the aurora, mark rites of passage with perilous hunts, and sing in long winter gatherings of sagas older than memory.  Though they share the same knowledge, skills, and resources as their southern kin, [[The Northmen's|Northmen]] fashion of furs and leathers, combined with their stark and elemental values of strength, loyalty, and truth spoken plainly often improperly mark them as "primitive" or "bumpkin" to outsiders.

!Notable Locations
* [[Kohor]] - the capital of The North, which still contains a great forge from [[The First Men]], ancestral home of [[House Karbold]]
* [[Westgate]] is a small military outpost built on the northern side of the [[The Westron Wall]].  It functions mainly as a deposit for the family members of the militia defending the wall.
* [[Vargë]] is a small village that represents the most northern territory of [[The Viridian Empire]].  While there are those that live beyond, they are not touched by [[The Empire|The Viridian Empire]]
* [[The Reach]] is the name of the most northern region of [[The Northlands]].  The small villages and towns here offer refuge and civilization, whereas the land outside the walls are full of untamed dangers.

!Adventure Hooks
''Something Wicked This Way Comes'' - Something is forcing the [[Jötnar]] of the mountains to migrate southward.  The party is hired by the local [[Reeve]] to eliminate these unwelcome brutes, offering gold for each [[Jötnar]] ear delivered.  However, when the characters face on of these towering giants, they might notice their sallow figures and the look of fear in their eyes - they're not attacking, they're running from something.
[>img[images/organizations/the-oathsworn.jpg]]
{{quote{
//Kill one of us, and three more will take their place.//
//''-[[Kellish|Kell]] Proverb''//
}}}

Those that follow the accumulated spiritual and mythological beliefs of the [[Kellish|Kell]] warrior culture call themselves [[The Oathsworn]] or [[The Chosen]].  Like the [[Kell]] themselves, their religion saw numerous changes throughout the course of history, with its origins being made during the tumultuous time of [[The Second Age]], when a small number of [[The First Men]] were all that remained of [[Humanity|Human]].  The religion has no central authority figure, however core beliefs, principles, and practices are kept by shamanistic religious figures known as [[The Oathsworn]].

!Zealots At The Core: The Chosen
{{quote{
//The Oath shall be kept by blood, sword, and axe.//
}}}
The Oathsworn followers are intensely devout in their beliefs, forming a deeply religious society.  Some within the group grew more militant and aggressive in response to issues of [[Kellish|Kell]] cultural identity waning in favor of what was seen as the declining morality brought by the influences of [[The Viridian Empire]].  They named themselves [[The Chosen]].  These zealots are an aggressive political force, with an astute graps of insurgency warfare.  They desire [[Kellish|Kell]] independence.  Due to most [[Kells|Kell]] having a connection to the oath, these zealots find helpful agents and sympathizers living among the populace.  While not all [[Kells|Kell]] agree with their tactics, many long for a return to the old ways.  [[The Chosen]] are primarily composed of [[Kells|Kell]] native to [[The Northlands]] of [[Kellos]].

!Foundations Of The Faith
{{quote{
//Blood; the blood of [[The First Men]] grants me Strength.//
//Strength; with Strength I protect my Life.//
//Life; Life preserves my Fate.//
//and may my Fate bring me Glory.//
//''-The Oath''//
}}}
The origin of The Oath solidified during [[The Second Age]] among [[The First Men]] of [[Asha]], who struggled to survive during [[The Cataclysm]].  The descendants of [[The First Men]] found themselves clinging to survive in a sundered planet filled with horrors and dangers never seen before.  With [[The Human Race|Human]] on the verge of extinction, The Oath bonded what would become [[The Kell|Kell]] by blood, sword and axe.  It hardened them in order to prepare them for the hard path of survival they had before them.
Every day brings challenge to the [[Kell]]. For the tribes of [[The Far North Of Kellos|The Reach]], food, water, and shelter are rare in their mountainous homes - a single mistake can bring down an entire tribe, while an individual's heroic effort can ensure the entire group's survival. The Kell take pride in individualistic skill and self-sufficiency. They love to win, but see defeat as a prod to improve themselves.

!Bone Criers
A [[Bone Crier]] is the name given to those [[Kell]] who can feel the natural forces of [[Asha]].  Gifted with [[Primal Magic]], they can hear [[Asha]] crying out in their bones.
The Obsidian Path is a distinct form of beliefs found within the [[Religion]] known as [[The Way]].  Practitioners follow strict ideological practices that differ from the other three paths.  They believe that the universe if full of [[Magic]], mystery, and [[Occult]]; all things to be used for the betterment of the living.  Powerful entities inhabit this universe, and those who follow The Obsidian Path beseech these entities for favors and gifts.  They have no taboo against what some of other cultures may call dark or evil; and weigh a calculated analysis of the benefit vs cost.

!Ethics and Morals
While outsiders may see The Obsidian Path as toying with dangerous powers outside of their control, in practice they are calculated in their endeavors to ensure the benefit outweighs the cost.  They believe that life is sacred, both at the beginning and the end of life.  They are not malicious nor frivolous with their incantations, and follow a strict code of ethics when taking life to power their [[Magic]].
* sacrifices of sentient beings should be given willingly
* don't allow ritual sacrifices to feel deliberate pain and suffering, give the entity no satisfaction
* give the entity as little as possible, you aren't worshiping it, you are using it
* be thankful and grateful for the sacrifice, honor them
* don't let creatures die in vain, death should mean something.

!Sacrifices
Ritualistic [[Human]] sacrifice may be done voluntarily for the betterment of the community.  For example, it is an honor to sacrifice oneself to end a plague, drought, or famine.  It is customary for the life of the sacrifice to be taken by a loved one, someone very close to the individual.  This is a great honor, and there is much beauty in this ceremony.
[>img[images/organizations/the-oeridian-kingdoms.jpg]]
The Oeridian Kingdoms are one of the oldest known [[Human]] civilizations in the western hemisphere, its founding dating back to the early [[The Third Age]] of [[Asha]] in 6175 [[IO]].
